content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Identify the latest machine learning model on Huggingface that specializes in detecting fake news, including the date of its last update.  Please interact with https://huggingface.co/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I need to search for machine learning models that specialize in "fake news detection." The search box at [1] is suitable for entering keywords like "fake news detection" to find relevant models on Huggingface.
Action: Type [1]; fake news detection
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The current page shows a model called "Qwen-Image-Edit," which focuses on image editing, not fake news detection. I need to refine my search or explore model filtering options for fake news detection specifically.
Action: Click [2]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.25
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: There is a filter text box for models at [45], which I can use to narrow the search results to models specialized in "fake news detection." This will help to efficiently find the latest relevant model.
Action: Type [45]; fake news
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.35
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The current search results do not display models related to fake news detection. Instead, models unrelated to the task (image classification and others) are shown. It may be necessary to use the full-text search option to get more relevant results.
Action: Click [46]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.4
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The full-text search page is now open, and there is a prominent search box at [17] labeled "Search anything on the Hub." This is the best place to enter a query like "fake news" to search across all models, datasets, and spaces for the most relevant recent model.
Action: Type [17]; fake news
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The top search result is "Falah/News_Detection," which is tagged with "fake news detection" and is specifically relevant to the task. I need to check the date of its last update, which is not visible in the current view. Clicking on this model will likely provide more detailed information, including the last update date.
Action: Click [18]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.75
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: This page shows the user's profile and recent project "Spaces" (apps/demos), not their models. I need to find the "News_Detection" model page, which should provide details about the model and the date it was last updated. I should scroll down or look for a "models" section if available.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.8
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "Recent Activity" section is visible, but none of the entries mention the "News_Detection" model. There may be more activities or specific models if I click "View all activity" at [6], which could show the last update date for "News_Detection."
Action: Click [6]
Confidence: 0.93
Completion: 0.85
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The visible activity log only shows models related to text generation and custom LLMs but does not show any activity or updates pertaining to the "News_Detection" or a dedicated fake news detection model. I need to specifically filter for all models by this creator to find "Falah/News_Detection" or continue searching for its update date. Clicking the "Models" filter at [27] could help narrow down the relevant results.
Action: Click [27]
Confidence: 0.96
Completion: 0.9
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: After filtering for "Models," only models such as "Falah/my-qlora-mistral7b-instruct" and "Falah/custom_llm" are displayed, but there is no "News_Detection" or model specifically mentioning fake news detection. This suggests "Falah/News_Detection" may have been incorrect or not up to date.
Action: GoBack
Confidence: 0.94
Completion: 0.92
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The view hasn't changed since the last step; only unrelated models are visible. Since filtering by user doesn't list any fake news detection models, it's possible the relevant model is from another author or requires a new search. The best option now is to return to the wider search results from earlier.
Action: GoBack
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.92
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The current view shows the "Spaces" section, which includes apps and demos (e.g., "Iraqi Music," "AutoTrain Advanced," "Math Puzzle Solve") from this user. There is no information about fake news detection models here. The best option now is to return to the wider search results or the previous search page to look for other models related to fake news detection.
Action: GoBack
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.92

content:
Thought: The screenshot still displays the "Spaces" section for the user "Falahgs Saleh," showing unrelated projects and not models relevant to fake news detection. To proceed, I should return to the broader search result page from earlier, which listed "Falah/News_Detection" and possibly other models that might fit the requirement.
Action: GoBack
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.92

However, the screenshot does not show the date of its last update. Clicking the model name at [19] should lead to the model's main page, where the update date and more details can be found.
Action: Click [19]
